intro: Cambessedesia espora subsp. espora, commonly known as the Espora subsp. of the genus Cambessedesia, is a rare and specialized plant species. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
